nodes.bodyText: No suggestions other than a test (which you have) which starts with everything you can think of (which it does) and makes it easy to add new cases as we learn of failures. I wouldn't overthink it unless you think there is a design issue. All I would say is that the name has me expect the typical java String.split(char delimiter) so it might be better named as splitOnWhitespace or something (not really fussy about what just the raw "split" verb is used in Java already

nodes.bodyText: Also need regression cover suggestions here - I presume these are wrong

That will blow up in the future, someone will send something "ridiculously" large (quotes because it is just ridiculous vs device constraints) through it and OOM. Might do the same OOM handling from deck images, where in the loop reading the data you do the super-rare OOM Error catch, and say something about "hey, so, this file has NNN lines and phones are small, maybe do a smaller amount at a time?"

I mean, you could convert to a stream-based style but I didn't even mention that at first because - to be clear - I understand streaming vs all-at-once is a completely different style, usually more difficult, and as it is likely only a small %age use case that a user themselves can work around if they have actionable information, it's not a requirement here IMHO

I like streaming (although it's painful in the version of Java that we use), but wanted to keep this as a (pretty much) true port of the Python in the first round.
I'll see what I can do in a follow-up commit
Okay... since we're in API 26 land, streaming is easy. Done!

I read the LICENSE file, and I like this header but I'd put the ported file link above it, then an explicit reference to the LICENSE file in the directory so it is unambiguous
Further thoughts?
Needs to be in all the files in the python dir though I think?

nodes.bodyText:
@mikehardy @Arthur-Milchior I'm going to mark this as ready for review if the CI passes.
I'd like to flag this pattern and see if you're OK with it. We might not get full coverage as most of the CI machines instrumented test in non-English locales.

s/most/all but one/ :-) - there is one and only one en-US but that should be sufficient ?
Either way, cool! This is a big feature

We're API 26+, CI doesn't have 26, we test on:

27 (fr-FR)
28 (default: en-US)
29 (pt-BR)
30 (de-DE)

so we're fine from a coverage POV, but only on one API level
Switched to en-US anyway. Can only test in CI now (my device is en-GB)
This no longer has a BOM :/

nodes.bodyText: I don't think we needed this - should either port or remove
What is a numeric field ?
See the commented code below - it performs a conversion to a float - I don't think it's necessary as we're string based - but I might be proven wrong at a later date
I would suggest creating a utils class Triple<First, Second, Third> as we already have Pair, so that this will avoid code duplication. As you may have seen, I expect to use such a class in other PR
